meanings.definition: The state or quality of being impermissible.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the impermissibilities of running in the hallway.
meanings.sent2: The sign clearly states the impermissibilities of parking in this area.
meanings.sent3: The impermissibilities of eating dessert before dinner were well-known in the household.
meanings.sent4: His actions were a display of the impermissibilities set by society.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of ignoring the impermissibilities were severe.

meanings.definition: Things that are not allowed or permitted.
meanings.sent1: The list of impermissibilities included talking during the exam.
meanings.sent2: The security guard enforced the impermissibilities of bringing pets into the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to understand the impermissibilities of jumping on the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The artist's work challenged the impermissibilities of traditional art forms.
meanings.sent5: The children were reminded of the impermissibilities before entering the museum.
